alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead; Gallatin; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 2:59PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Training thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Madison, southeastern Beaverhead and south central Gallatin Counties through at least 400 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms developing near Monida and moving east at 25 mph along and just north of the Idaho border of Southwest Montana. These storms have been training, meaning they continue to develop and move over the same areas. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Yellowstone, Monida, Lakeview, Yellowstone Village, Targhee Pass, Snowline and Raynolds Pass. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 1 and 10 . Highway 191 between mile markers 5 and 10, and between mile markers 31 and 37. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persistent rainfall these storms may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Occasional cloud to ground lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
